alert.note: Alert for Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 12:10PM EDT until July 11 at 8:20AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... White River At West Hartford affecting Windsor County. For the White River...including West Hartford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at West Hartford. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Route 14 west of West Hartford will be flooded, and there will be widespread field flooding in the White River valley. At 19.0 feet, Floodwaters will approach homes and businesses near the river, and Route 14 will be inundated. There will be widespread flooding of fields and lowlands through the White River Valley. At 21.0 feet, Route 14 will be flooded in several locations, and water will inundate homes and businesses near the river. There will be widespread flooding of fields and lowlands throughout the White River Valley. This stage is equivalent to the FEMA 1 Percent Annual Chance Flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 20.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EDT.
